alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe; Nash; Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 28 at 12:24AM EDT until August 28 at 3:30AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Edgecombe County in central North Carolina... Central Nash County in central North Carolina... Northeastern Wilson County in central North Carolina... * Until 330 AM EDT. * At 1224 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rocky Mount, Nashville, Elm City, Sharpsburg, Pinetops, Spring Hope, Macclesfield, Tar River Reservoir and Willbanks. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
